revised_title: Discovery of a New Hard Carbonate of Lime Species and Its Properties
tldr: The author discovered a new species of hard carbonate of lime with unique properties. The crystals are harder and more resistant than common carbonate of lime, and they exhibit various forms and structures. The author also discusses the matrix of this substance, which is a brown oxide of iron mixed with argill and calcareous particles. This new species of carbonate of lime is found in Carinthia, Transylvania, and Scotland.
